info.description: The transactional data API allows you to retrieve data from your historical payments, such as Authorisations and Transactions.
info.title: Transactional Data

get.description:
Return a list of all authorisations, restricted by your allianceCode,
partnerCode or merchant ID (as appropriate) for the given datetime range.

schema.description: Used for pagination based on the given limit and offset.  Contains `true` if there are more results beyond the current 'page',  otherwise `false`.
The list of returned authorisation objects.

errors.title: Bad Request - Incorrect or Missing Query Parameter/Header/Field
errors.detail: There is a validation error. Please fix and repeat your request.

errors.title: Authentication error
errors.detail: No valid API key or credential has been provided in the request.

errors.title: Forbidden error
errors.detail: Access to the requested resource is forbidden.

errors.title: Resource not found
errors.detail: The requested resource cannot be found.

errors.title: Too many requests
errors.detail: Too many requests have been received too quickly. Please back off your requests and try again.

errors.title: Internal server error
errors.detail: Sorry, something has gone wrong at our end. If this persists please contact support and provide the value of your Trace-Id header.

get.description: Returns single Authorisation for the given unique ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique system id for the authorisation to retrieve.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique id of the authorisation to retrieve

get.description:
Return a list of all transactions, restricted by your allianceCode,
partnerCode or merchant ID (as appropriate) for the given datetime range.

schema.description: Used for pagination based on the given limit and offset.  Contains `true` if there are more results beyond the current 'page',  otherwise `false`.
The list of returned transaction objects.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique id of the transaction to retrieve

partnerCode or merchant ID (as appropriate) for the given datetime range.

schema.description: Used for pagination based on the given limit and offset.  Contains `true` if there are more results beyond the current 'page',  otherwise `false`.
The list of returned funding objects.

get.description: Returns a single Funding for the given unique ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The funding Id for the record being retrieved, found in the `id` field in listed records

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique id of the funding to retrieve

get.description: Lists the Funding Detail rows for a specific Funding

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The funding Id for the detail records being retrieved, found in the `id` field in listed funding records

Error.description: This is the generic Error Response to be used for all Errors sent back in responses.
Error.title: Error Response

title.description: Readable error message that could be displayed in a UI

detail.description: Further description provided to give wider context into the error

source.description: Optional: Known source of error such as missing or invalid field in a request

Authorisation.title: Authorisation Object
Authorisation.description:
An authorisation record is created for every payment transaction and contains detail about the
payment amounts, instrument used, environment captured and whether it was approved or declined.

merchant.description: A merchant is the business entity that the transaction was performed at.

meta.description:
Reference metadata used by both the merchant and acquirer to link the
authorisation to other records or systems.

products.description: References to any products recorded as part of the transaction.

financial.description: Groups financial and currency data for the transaction

transactionAttributes.description: Additional attributes regarding the transaction, such as reponse codes as part of security checks.

captureEnvironment.description: Detail about the environment used to capture the payment, such as a terminal.

captureMethod.description: The method for which the payment instrument details were captured.

_links.description: A collection of references to other related items in our APIs, using HAL-style formatting, use these for reconciling the current record against other records

transactions.description:
A reference to the `/transactions` endpoint for any transaction records related to the current authorisation, using the following params:
  
* `orderId` field from the current authorisations 
* `postedAfter` the current `created` date 
* `postedBefore` the current day

Payment-Instrument-Category.title: Payment-Instrument-Category
Payment-Instrument-Category.description:
The discriminator used to determine the payment category and object type.

For more details see our page on [payment instruments](https://docs.fiserv.dev/public/docs/payment-instruments).

Payment-Instrument-Card-Brand.title: Payment Instrument Card Brand
Payment-Instrument-Card-Brand.description: The brand or scheme of payment card.

Payment-Instrument-Alternative-Service.title: Payment Instrument Alternative Service
Payment-Instrument-Alternative-Service.description: Name of the APM (Alternative Payment Method) service used for the payment.

Payment-Instrument-Alternative.title: Payment Instrument Alternative
Payment-Instrument-Alternative.description: Alternative type of payment such as a digital wallet.

Payment-Instrument-Cash.title: Payment Instrument Cash
Payment-Instrument-Cash.description:
Cash based payment, no additional data is stored in this case 
about the 'instrument'

Payment-Instrument-Group.title: Payment Instrument Group (Full)
Payment-Instrument-Group.description:
The instrument used to make the payment, which will be one of a few specific categories.

For more details see our page on 
[payment types](https://docs.fiserv.com/docs/general/ZG9jOjI2NjE5MjE0-payment-types).

Transaction.title: Transaction Object
Transaction.description:
A transaction record is created for every cleared authorisation, and indicates that money is ready to be
moved (from consumer to merchant) for that payment.

allOf.description:
The date and time (in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`)
the clearing message was sent for the transaction.

The date and time (in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`)
the authorisation occurred, relative to the terminal location.

status.description: Whether the transaction has yet been cleared or rejected.

merchant.description: A merchant is the business entity that the transaction was performed at.

meta.description:
Reference metadata used by both the merchant and acquirer to link the
transaction to other records or systems.

allOf.description: The unique ID of the specific funding detail row linked to this transaction.

originalReference.description: Optional reference to the original transaction record, in the case of reject that was re-processed.

terminalBatchNumber.description: Clearing batch number defined by the terminal that posted the transaction for clearing.

acquirerReferenceNumber.description: Also known as 'ARN', an industry standard unique reference number that can be used to trace a transaction between acquirer and issuer. Useful in cases of refund processing.

financial.description: Financial details for the transaction, such as amounts and fees

amounts.description: Currency amounts relating to the transaction

allOf.description: Base currency for the amounts listed in ISO 4217 format
Amount transacted between cardholder and merchant
Amount of cashback included in the transaction
Amount of tip included in the transaction

fees.description: The fees or charges associated with this cleared transaction, such as merchant service charge or network interchange fee.

type.description: The type of fee or charge, such as `INTERCHANGE` or `MERCHANT_SERVICE_CHARGE`

allOf.description: The fee amount, shown as a **positive** currency amount. This may be a fractional currency value of up to 5 decimal places.

funding.description: Detail about the funding relevant to this transaction.

allOf.description: Currency for funding amountsfor the amounts listed in ISO 4217 format
The gross amount to be funded for the transaction before any fees
The total amount of fees deducted from this transaction for funding, shown as a positive amount
The final net amount to be funded for the transaction

captureEnvironment.description: Detail about the environment used to capture the payment, such as a terminal.

allOf.description: System which processed the transaction for clearing.

captureMethod.description: The method for which the payment instrument details were captured.

_links.description: A collection of references to other related items in our APIs, using HAL-style formatting, use these for reconciling the current record against other records

authorisations.description:
A reference to the `/authorisations` endpoint for any authorisation records related to the current transaction, using the following params:
  
* `orderId` field from the current transaction 
* `createdAfter` the current `authorised` date 
* `createdBefore` the current `posted` date

fundings.description:
A reference to the `/fundings` endpoint for any funding records related to the current transaction, using the following params:
  
* `fundingDetailId` field from the current transaction 
* `fundedAfter` the current `posted` date 
* `fundedBefore` the current date

Payment-Instrument-Alternative-Thin.title: Payment Instrument Alternative
Payment-Instrument-Alternative-Thin.description: Alternative type of payment such as a digital wallet.

Payment-Instrument-Cash-Thin.title: Payment Instrument Cash
Payment-Instrument-Cash-Thin.description:
Cash based payment, no additional data is stored in this case 
about the 'instrument'

Payment-Instrument-Group-Thin.title: Payment Instrument Group (Full)
Payment-Instrument-Group-Thin.description:
The instrument used to make the payment, which will be one of a few specific categories.

For more details see our page on [payment types](https://docs.fiserv.com/docs/general/ZG9jOjI2NjE5MjE0-payment-types).

Record-Id.title: Record ID
Record-Id.description: Unique system identifier of the record in our system.

Funding.title: Funding Object
Funding.description: A summary of a funding record which summarises a transfer between acquierer and merchant, for more details see the 'funding detail' object

allOf.description: The date and time (in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`) the money was (or will be) funded into the recipients account.
The date and time (in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`) the funding order was generated.

status.description: Whether the money has actually been released to the merchant account or is still being held

type.description:
The nature of the funding record / payment, such as whether it is a standard  payment to the merchants account, or a collection from their account.
Examples:

  * `250` - Merchant Payment (money being send from us to the merchant)
  * `270` - Merchant Collection (money being sent from the merchant to use, i.e. for charges / refunds)

code.description: A numberic code which represents the type, can be used for programmatic checking

description.description: A human readable text description for the type

merchant.description:
The merchant (business entity) being funded. 
This is usually identical to the merchant that processed the transactions, but may differ from the funding details records based on merchant group/subgroup hierarchy.

allOf.description: Unique ID of the account in our system

reference.description: Internal account reference used by our funding system

allOf.description: The account currency, may be different from the current funding from the acquirer

type.description: The nature of the account being used, as it is common to have accounts for specific purposes.

code.description: A numberic code which represents the type, can be used for programmatic checking

description.description: A human readable text description for the type

allOf.description: Final amount to be funded, in **account** currency, this may be negative in the case where it is a collection *from* the merchant

meta.description: Reference metadata used by both the merchant and acquirer to link the funding to other records or systems.

paymentReference.description: Internal reference for the funding record in our funding system, links all funding records to a singe payment together

_links.description: A collection of references to other related items in our APIs, using HAL-style formatting, use these for reconciling the current record against other records

transactions.description:
A reference to the `/transactions` endpoint for any transactions records related to the current funding, using the following params:

* `fundingId` as the `id` field from the current funding record
* `postedAfter` the day before the current `posted` date 
* `postedBefore` the current `posted` posted

funding-details.description: A reference to the `/funding/{id}/details` endpoint for the detail records related to this funding (by ID). For ecommerce this will not be present.

Funding-Detail.title: Funding Detail Object
Funding-Detail.description: A specific line item row from a funding order (see 'funding' object)

allOf.description:
The date and time (in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`)
the item was generated for funding.

type.description: The nature of the funding detail, such as whether it is a standard  payment deposit based on transactions, or a charge from a set of disputes.

code.description: A numberic code which represents the type, can be used for programmatic checking

description.description: A human readable text description for the type

merchant.description:
The merchant which was the 'transacting' entity for any funded transactions.
This is usually the same as the merchant on the funding record, however may differ based on the configured merchant group/subgroup hierarchy.

paymentInstrument.description: Information about the type of payment method used relating to this funding detail record, such as card brand for any relevant transactions.

allOf.description: The brand or scheme of payment card related to this funding detail, only populated in case of `CARD` `category` transactions.
The service name for the alternative payment method related to this funding detail, only populated in the case of `ALTERNATIVE` `category` transactions.

financial.description: Financial details for the funding row

allOf.description: The funding or transaction currency, may be different from the account currency

slips.description: The number of items (such as transactions) linked to this funding detail entry

allOf.description: Gross amount for the slips related to this record, in **funding** currency
Net amount to be funded, in **account** currency, this may be negative in the case of fees / collection

fxRate.description: Applicable foreign exange rate used when account currency and funding currency differ

meta.description:
Reference metadata used by both the merchant and acquirer to link the
funding to other records or systems.

paymentReference.description: Internal reference for the funding record in our funding system, links all funding records to a singe payment together

detailReference.description: Internal reference for this detail record in our funding system

_links.description: A collection of references to other related items in our APIs, using HAL-style formatting, use these for reconciling the current record against other records

transactions.description:
A reference to the `/transactions` endpoint for any transactions records related to the current funding detail, using the following params:

* `fundingDetailId` as the `id` field from the current funding detail record
* `postedAfter` the day before the current `posted` date 
* `postedBefore` the current `posted` posted

funding.description: A reference to the `/fundings` endpoint for the parent funding summary which includes this detail record.

AVS-Response-Code.title: AVS Response Code
AVS-Response-Code.description:
Address Verification Service (AVS) helps to protect against fraudulent use of cards, particularly
in ecommerce transactions, by verifying the cardholderâ€™s billing address against those provided.

The single-character codes returned by this service are defined by the card schemes; for more details 
and a list of possible values see our page on [response codes](https://docs.fiserv.dev/public/docs/response-codes#address-verification-service-avs).

Alliance-Code.title: Alliance Code
Alliance-Code.description:
An alliance is typically an organization holding an acquiring licence issued by card 
schemes (like VISA, MasterCard etc). This code is assigned by us.

Authorisation-Channel.title: Authorisation Channel
Authorisation-Channel.description: A categorisation for the system which generated the transaction record. The most common being point of sale (such as an in-store card payment) or ecommerce (via an online store),  but also includes channels like pay by link, mail order and telephone order.

Authorisation-Code.title: Authorisation Code
Authorisation-Code.description:
6-digit code returned by the issuer responsible for approving the authorisation in the event that it
is approved. Can be used along with other metadata to reference the authorisation, such as 
in the case of a dispute.

Authorisation-Created.title: Authorisation Created
Authorisation-Created.description:
Date and time the authorisation was processed (in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`). 
Determined on the basis of the merchants location.

Authorisation-GUID.title: Authorisation GUID
Authorisation-GUID.description:
Identifier assigned to the authorisation which can uniqely identify and link related messages 
between the full authorisation, clearing and settlement process.

Authorisation-Platform-Code.title: Authorisation Platform Code
Authorisation-Platform-Code.description: The platform or system which processed the authorisation, such as 'IPG' (International Payment Gateway).

Authorisation-Reference-Id.title: Authorisation Reference Id
Authorisation-Reference-Id.description:
Optional Id used to link together authorisation pre-auth records, 
such as initial pre-auth, increment and completion.

For normal authorisation records this is usually null.

Authorisation-Reversal-Flag.title: Reversal Flag
Authorisation-Reversal-Flag.description:
A flag indicating if the authorisation was reversed or not. 
A reversal is the act of 'undoing' a transaction, which in the case
of authorisations results in any hold on funds being released.

Authorisation-Status.title: Authorisation Status
Authorisation-Status.description: A flag indicating the status of the authorisation and whether it has been approved.

CVV-Result-Code.title: CVV Result Code
CVV-Result-Code.description:
The CVV Number ("Card Verification Value") is the 3 digit number on the back of a credit or debit card.
It adds a layer of additional security for ecommerce transactions to help prevent card fraud.

On American Express branded credit or debit cards, it is a 4 digit numeric code. 

| Code | Description |
|---|---|
| M | CVV2 Match |
| N | CVV2 Not match |
| P | Not Processed |
| S | Should be on the card, but merchant indicates it is not |
| U | User is not certified or has not provided Visa with encryption keys or both |

Currency-Amount.title: Currency Amount
Currency-Amount.description: The amount of currency in ISO 4217 format (to 2 decimal places)

Customer-IP-Address.title: Customer IP Address
Customer-IP-Address.description: IP address of the customer recorded by the payment gateway, for example when payments are made via a hosted web store.

DCC-Currency.title: DCC Currency Code
DCC-Currency.description: ISO Alpha 3 currency code for the DCC conversion in the merchant's currency.

DCC-Indicator.title: DCC Indicator
DCC-Indicator.description:
This indicates whether the transaction is DCC transaction, DCC was accepted or not applicable.

| Code | Description |
|---|---|
| NONE | Non-DCC |
| DCC | DCC converted transaction |
| DECLINED | Declined by cardholder |

DCC-Rate.title: DCC Conversion Rate
DCC-Rate.description:
Dynamic currency conversion (DCC) is a credit card feature that allows you to make a point-of-sale (POS) credit card purchase in a foreign country using the currency of your home country.

The rate is the conversion from the authorised amount into the merchant's currency.

DateTime.title: Datetime
DateTime.description: An ISO 8601 datetime in the format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`

External-Merchant-Id.title: External Merchant id
External-Merchant-Id.description: External merchant id provided by client (if merchant ids have been pre allocated) or  generated by our systems during merchant boarding.

Installment-Amount-First.title: First Instalment Amount
Installment-Amount-First.description: The amount of first instalment in auth message currency.

Installment-Amount-Total.title: Instalment Total Amount
Installment-Amount-Total.description: Total sum of all instalments in authorisation currency

Installment-Deferred-Period.title: Instalment Deferred Period
Installment-Deferred-Period.description: Number of months for which payment shall not be enforceable (buy today, pay later). Can have a value from 0 to 99.

Instrument-Expiry-Date.title: Instrument Expiry Date
Instrument-Expiry-Date.description: Expiry date of payment instrument in the format 'YYMM'.

Instrument-Number-Masked.title: Instrument Number Masked
Instrument-Number-Masked.description:
Masked instrument number or account number used to pay for
goods or services such as a PAN, PayPal account reference, bank account number. 

With first 6 and last 4 digits visible in the clear.

Instrument-Service-Type.title: Instrument Service Type
Instrument-Service-Type.description:
Used for card-based payments to determine the service type, 
such as credit or debit.

Instrument-Subtype.title: Instrument Subtype
Instrument-Subtype.description:
Additional information about the type of instrument, for example 
card products such as Visa Select (N2) and MasterCard Platinum (MPL).

Instrument-Token.title: Instrument Token
Instrument-Token.description:
Reference or token for a payment instrument, for example:

  * A token generated from a card number by using the Payments API
  * A system-specific reporting token
  * A PAR (Payment Account Reference)

Issuer-Response-Code.title: Issuer Response Code
Issuer-Response-Code.description:
Code send back from the issuer in response to an authorisation request which contains 
detail on whether the request was approved or declined and the reason for a decline.

For example, a successful authorisation is identified by the code `00`, 
while a declined authorisation based on insufficient funds would be `51`.

For more detail on these codes and a full list of examples, see our page on 
[response codes](https://docs.fiserv.dev/public/docs/response-codes).

Limit.title: Limit
Limit.description:
Number of elements to be returned in a single query.

Can be used for page/offset or cursor based pagination

Merchant-Category-Code.title: Merchant Category Code
Merchant-Category-Code.description:
A [Merchant Category Code (MCC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Merchant_category_code) 
is assigned to each merchant by an acquirer. It classifies the merchant based on the type of goods or services provided, 
as each industry has different transaction patterns and differing levels of fraud risk. 

**Examples:**

| Code | Description |
|---|---|
| 0742 | Veterinary Services |
| 0763 | Agricultural Co-operatives |
| 1520 | General Contractors - Residential and Commercial |

For a **full list** of example values, see our [reference guide](https://docs.fiserv.dev/public/docs/merchant-category-codes).

Merchant-Location.title: Merchant Location
Merchant-Location.description: The Alpha 3 ISO location of the merchant.

Merchant-Reference1.title: Merchant Reference 1
Merchant-Reference1.description:
Flexible reference field provided by the merchant via our payment gateway, usually something
that is printed on the receipt and uniquely references the transaction in the merchants
system.

Merchant-Reference2.title: Merchant Reference 2
Merchant-Reference2.description:
Optional reference number provided by the merchant via our payment gateway, such as an
order reference number. Can be used in addition to `merchantReference1` to provide additional
linking to the merchant's internal systems.

Merchant-Trade-Name.title: Merchant Trade Name
Merchant-Trade-Name.description: Trade name of the merchant, often printed on a card receipt.

Offset.title: Offset
Offset.description:
Starting point to start retrieving the elements from. It is "0" based i.e. value "0" signifies the first page.

This can be used with "limit".

Can be used for page/offset based pagination.

Partner-Code.title: Partner Code
Partner-Code.description: Partners are typically companies (such as Payment Facilitators, Independent Software Vendors, Independent Sale Organisations) who can contract merchants for card acceptance but they don't hold an acquiring licence so must always be authorized by an Alliance.

Record-Id_2.title: Record ID
Record-Id_2.description: Unique system identifier of the record in our system.

Reservation-Number.title: Reservation Number
Reservation-Number.description:
Reservation number generated by the merchant and used as a reference. 
For example, in transactions involving hotel reservations.

Retrieval-Reference-Number.title: Retrieval Reference Number
Retrieval-Reference-Number.description:
12 digit reference number following ISO 8583 which can be used with other key data elements to 
identify and track all messages related to a given transaction. 

It is usually assigned by the acquirer, but it may be assigned by a
merchant or by an individual electronic terminal.

Sort.title: Sort
Sort.description: Specifies the sequence of elements and order to sort the payload by

Terminal-Activation-Flag.title: Terminal Activation Flag
Terminal-Activation-Flag.description: Whether the terminal has been activated with a terminal ID.

Terminal-Capability.title: Terminal Capability
Terminal-Capability.description: Capability of the terminal to read the payment instrument.

Terminal-Capture-Mode.title: Terminal Capture Model
Terminal-Capture-Mode.description: Describes mode of capturing authorisation at the POI.

Terminal-Id-External.title: External Terminal Id
Terminal-Id-External.description: Terminal ID is the number assigned to the POI and used between POI and Central Acceptance Host and displayed on terminal and used for reconciliation purposes.

Terminal-Pin-Capture-Capability.title: PIN Capture Capability
Terminal-Pin-Capture-Capability.description:
Maximum PIN length which the terminal is capable of capturing. 
Represented as numeric value. 

Field value is `0` in the case where there is no PIN capture capability.

Terminal-Serial-Number.title: Terminal Serial Number
Terminal-Serial-Number.description:
The device serial number of the terminal. The format may depend on the specific
terminal or type, so the field should be assumed to contain a string with a flexible format.

Terminal-Workstation-Id.title: Workstation Id
Terminal-Workstation-Id.description: Identifies the workstation ID of the merchant's ePOS system

Transaction-Currency-Code.title: Authorised Currency Code
Transaction-Currency-Code.description:
ISO alpha 3 currency code of the transaction amounts in cardholder currency. 
In cases that DCC is used (see `financials.dcc`), it may differ from the merchant's currency.

Transaction-Message-Type-Code.title: Message Type
Transaction-Message-Type-Code.description:
[ISO 8583](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8583) code determining type of transaction 
message being submitted, for example `0110` is an authorisation request response. Each digit has a specific meaning
following the format below:

* `0xxx` - version of ISO 8583 (0 = 1987 version)
* `x1xx` - class of the message (1 = authorisation message)
* `xx1x` - function of the message (1 = response)
* `xxx0` - who began the communication (0 = acquirer)

Transaction-Order-Id.title: Transaction Order Id
Transaction-Order-Id.description:
Unique ID of the end-to-end sale which can link together multiple authorisation or 
cleared transaction records.

Transaction-Product-ID.title: Product ID
Transaction-Product-ID.description: Unique identifier or internal product code of a product related to the transaction.

Transaction-Source.title: Transaction Source
Transaction-Source.description: A description of the where the transaction originated, in addition to the `channel` field.  Gives more detail on the type of terminal or system used.

Transaction-Store-Id.title: Store Id
Transaction-Store-Id.description: A digital store id assigned in our payment gateway. The store holds configuration such as what payment methods are accepted.

Transaction-Subtype.title: Transaction Subtype
Transaction-Subtype.description:
Optional subtype for the authorisation, used to indicate whether it was part of a 
pre-auth sequence.

Most authorisations are known as a 'purchase' or 'sale', which involves both the pre-auth
and completion in one (in which case this field would be null). 

However for purchases like a pay-at-pump petrol transaction, a pre-auth may occur first for a 
fixed amount, before a completion finalises the transaction. In which case there would be
two authorisation records in our system.

Transaction-Type.title: Transaction Type
Transaction-Type.description: The nature of the transaction, which often signifies how it is processed. The most common type is a purchase (the transfer of money for goods or services), but may refer to things like a refund or card verification.

UCAF-ECI-Identifier.title: UCAF ECI Identifier
UCAF-ECI-Identifier.description:
Represents the level of security used for an ecommerce transaction.   

3-D Secure, also known as payer authentication, is a security 
protocol that helps to prevent fraud in online credit and debit card transactions by
asking the user to provide authentication approval.

The decision for approving the transaction based on this data may be made by
the merchant or the issuer / card schemes or both (which is referred to as full). 

The important note being that a party that approves the transaction on this basis
accepts liability.

AppKey.name: Api-Key
AppKey.description: Authorization value in header (obtain from developer portal)

createdAfter.name: createdAfter
createdAfter.description:
Filter authorisations on the `created` field from the given date value in ISO 8601 format  `yyyy-MM-dd`, anything from the time `00:00:00` on the given day would match.
**Default:** Current day

createdBefore.name: createdBefore
createdBefore.description:
Filter authorisations on the `created` field up to and including the given date value in ISO  8601 format `yyyy-MM-dd`, anything up the the time `23:59:59` on the given day would match.

**Default:** Current day

postedAfter.name: postedAfter
postedAfter.description:
Filter transactions on the `posted` field from the given date value in ISO 8601 format  `yyyy-MM-dd`, anything from the time `00:00:00` on the given day would match.

**Default:** Current day

postedBefore.name: postedBefore
postedBefore.description:
Filter transactions on the `posted` field up to and including the given date value in ISO  8601 format `yyyy-MM-dd`, anything up the the time `23:59:59` on the given day would match.

**Default:** Current day

fundedAfter.name: fundedAfter
fundedAfter.description:
Filter fundings on the `funded` field from the given date value in ISO 8601 format  `yyyy-MM-dd`, anything from the time `00:00:00` on the given day would match.

**Default:** 30 days prior to the current day

fundedBefore.name: fundedBefore
fundedBefore.description:
Filter fundings on the `funded` field up to and including the given date value in ISO  8601 format `yyyy-MM-dd`, anything up the the time `23:59:59` on the given day would match.

**Default:** Current day

sortAuthorisations.name: sort
sortAuthorisations.description:
Defines how to sort the records returned. Must be specified in the syntax '+' (ascending) or '-' (descending) followed by the field name.

For example: `+created` would sort by the 'created' field ascending.

**Allowed fields**: `created`

**Default:** `+created` (oldest first)

sortTransactions.name: sort
sortTransactions.description:
Defines how to sort the records returned. Must be specified in the syntax '+' (ascending) or '-' (descending) followed by the field name.

For example: `+posted` would sort by the 'posted' field ascending.

**Allowed fields**: `posted`

**Default:** `+posted` (oldest first)

sortFundings.name: sort
sortFundings.description:
Defines how to sort the records returned. Must be specified in the syntax '+' (ascending) or '-' (descending) followed by the field name.

For example: `+funded` would sort by the 'funded' field ascending.

**Allowed fields**: `funded`

**Default:** `+funded` (oldest first)

sortFundingDetails.name: sort
sortFundingDetails.description:
Defines how to sort the records returned. Must be specified in the syntax '+' (ascending) or '-' (descending) followed by the field name.

For example: `+posted` would sort by the 'posted' field ascending.

**Allowed fields**: `posted`

**Default:** `+posted` (oldest first)

Partner-Code.name: Partner-Code
Partner-Code.description:
For use by an alliance when there is a need to filter on a specific partner within their scope.
May be restricted based on the API key.

Merchant-Id.name: Merchant-Id
Merchant-Id.description:
For use by an alliance or partner when there is a need to filter on a specific merchant within their scope.
May be restricted based on the API key.

storeId.name: storeId
storeId.description:
For use by an alliance, partner or merchant when there is a need to filter on a specific store within their scope.
May be restricted based on the API key.

terminalId.name: terminalId
terminalId.description: Filter for records made on a specific terminal by ID.

orderId.name: orderId
orderId.description: Filter for records linked by the order ID from our payment gateway.

fundingDetailId.name: fundingDetailId
fundingDetailId.description: Filter for records linked by a funding detail record's `id` via the `/fundings/{id}/details` endpoint.

fundingId.name: fundingId
fundingId.description: Filter for records linked by a funding record's `id` via the `/fundings` endpoint.

Trace-Id.description: An internal unique ID for this request which can be used for diagnosing issues and corresponding with support.
